in California's history it seemed like anything was possible. This is a photohistory tour of the Valentine's day weddings in San Francisco in 2004. Click on "Comments" under the pictures to get the full story.
 
 Please be aware that this thread is for friendly and informative purposes only. It is not intended as a debate on the relative morality of homosexuality and gay marriage, so please don't leave me any snarky comments.
 
 Thanks,
 
 -C

 I believe the link requires a log-in.
 Thanks.

I posted this in a couple other forums, and either someone hacked me, or my photo album self-destructed. I lost all my photos and had to uninstall it. In a few days I'll have it back online, though, or something similar. Maybe on a 3rd party site. :)
OK, it's fixed finally. It's at a different address, though. Valentine's weekend weddings if you still want to see it.

Very nice :) 
 
 Were there protesters there? I heard they were blocking the doors.

All I saw when I was there was one guy walking up and down the line quoting bible verses. He did not get a warm reception. :) The person in the photos being interviewed by the newspaper said to him, "If this is so important to you, why did you wait until this morning when it quit raining to come out here? Where were you last night when we were all sleeping on the sidewalk in the rain?". Needless to say, he quietly shuffled off to harass someone else.
 
 The day we were there there were no protesters to speak of and all the bystanders were friendly and supportive. People were honking and waving as they drove by.
